author: Jhonald Cruz
text:
To the Grailed Team,

Recently I’ve made a purchase for a pair of Jordan 1 Royals 2017 release. The pair was listed under jakobdewald (username) and his history was 22 transactions with 11x5-star reviews. Before I made a purchase I recently made contact to your support team to verify the listing and the response I received was to send your team photos with my username, date, and the word “Grailed” as a tag. So basically with your response I had to purchase it first before I can have it “authenticated”. (I should have insisted to verify the listing before purchasing since your website says you offer that service.) The photos sent by the seller checks out with an “authentic” pair and I’ve also reached out to the original retail store (basketzone.net) where the seller bought it to confirm the purchase. Everything checked out at this point.

So I went ahead and purchased the pair and once I received it quickly sent the photos (w/tags) to grailed support team. Note that before I sent the photos I also did my own checks, compared it with my Jordan 1 Breds (2016) and also used “Legitcheck App” for reference and the pair I bought pretty much matches the “authentic” pair. Now after a week, I received an email from Grailed’s support team with a response that the seller sold me an “inauthentic” pair and they have frozen the seller’s account. This was a surprise and complete shock to me. I was expecting a positive outcome. The reasons that the moderators used were:

1.	The overall shape is off
2.	Heel shape looks off, especially the heel tab
3.	The wings logo is unclear and dull

I’ve asked on facebook groups and checked online, compared the pair I bought to my pair of Jordan 1s, it checks out to be fine. I just don’t agree with the moderator’s findings. I’ve been trying to reach out with your support team again to make an appeal but I have not received any response at all. I’ve tried twitter, Instagram, reddit, trustpilot and not a single response from you. I just want to be fair to the seller who has his account frozen and basically make the necessary corrections. I’ve made a paypal claim/dispute as per your advice to document what has been happening and I’ve been communicating with the seller trying to resolve the issue. He wants to clear his name and he is sure that there is a mistake somewhere. He should have tried and reached out to you by now. But the problem is whether it will be looked into for investigation. I really hope your team would do the necessary actions because in a way your credibility is at stake here. There must be some sort of misunderstanding or error that has been made. So please kindly look into this.

This is my second purchase in grailed and both of them has been only but problems. My first purchase never arrived. Now this time I requested to verify a listing but for you to do that I have to buy it and then come back to say it’s “inauthentic”.
